content.description: (From the FA-er) Fun traverse line with a nice topout. The landing is okay but don’t roll too far or you’ll take a tumble off the cliff. Roof is above the quarry so you’ll have to hike around to find it. Good luck. You’ll be happy you searched this one out.
Start on a blocky jug and sit low. Move straight up through some crimps and a cool triangle hold. Gain the small ledge and top out.
content.protection: Multiple pads if you got em. Spotter or two. The landing is super sketchy and steep.
content.location: Down the trail from the prow, with the lake to your left, the quarry cliff is on the right. Go past the first obvious face and follow it down almost until the end.

content.description: Start matching on a nice small rail. Move up to a crimp both left and right. There's a crimp midway if you need to bump. Stay real tight and get up to the crack. Feet up and hit the lip. Easy press to top out. There's a crimp over the lip on the next ledge to help finish but I found I didn't need it.
content.protection: Pads and spotter. REALLY BAD LANDING.  Don't fall you will probably get messed up. Your crash pads will only be half on the landing.

content.description: Match on a blocky jug to start.  Move up with your left hand to a crimpy side pull and hit the next crimp with your right.  Adjust feet and move to a matching crimp.  Reach up to nice ledge.  Fat left hand pinch and hit a good crimp up right.  Sit heavy on the crimp and pull up to decent jug left.  Top out using good jug. You can traverse left or right if you're sketched about topping out.  Crux seems to be the crimpy side pulls at the beginning.
content.protection: Pad and spotters. Semi sketch landing.
content.location: Above the "nest" area. Very obvious climb on the right side of the trail if walking in from the prow.

content.description: Start on same blocky jug as Draw Backwards. Move to the vertical crimps to the left. There are about 4-5 holds along the seam. Once on the ledge finish the same as Draw Backwards.
content.location: Quarried cliff on the right side down the trail from the prow.

content.description: A band of quarried granite. Some decent routes with a fair amount of choss. Some landings are junk and some are workable but none are perfect. The most obvious face will be first. Follow the base to find more lines.
